channel.title: Using commands at a certain time?
channel.description:
How can I make it so, if I type:
::helpsession
People can type ::help to go the the help session place. but, if I type:
::sessionover
Then players can no longer use the ::help command?

item.title: Using commands at a certain time?
item.dc:creator: @Adelmas Adelmas
item.description:
@Adelmas wrote:

I got it, thanks.

Read full topic
item.source: Using commands at a certain time?

item.source: Using commands at a certain time?

item.title: Using commands at a certain time?
item.dc:creator: @Avalon Avalon
item.description:
@Avalon wrote:

yea, but it evaluates the command.equalsIgnoreCase(“help”) statement too, and if that returns false then the else statement is invoked. So if a player types any other command other than “::help”, he/she will get the message “You cannot do this, the help session is over”.

Read full topic
item.source: Using commands at a certain time?

item.title: Using commands at a certain time?
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

The else statement checks the boolean value, doesn’t it?

Read full topic
item.source: Using commands at a certain time?

item.title: Using commands at a certain time?
item.dc:creator: @Avalon Avalon
item.description:
@Avalon wrote:

The help command should be rewritten to this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("help"))
{
    if (!help)
        sendMessage("You cannot do this, the help session is over");
    else
    {
        teleportToX = 2525;
        teleportToY = 4773;
     }
}

because the other way the else would be acted upon no matter what if the command wasn’t equal to “help”.

Read full topic
item.source: Using commands at a certain time?

item.title: Using commands at a certain time?
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

[code]import java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList;
public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

         public boolean help = false;
public int SERVER_EXPERIENCE = 20; // this is the base for all exp given to skills, its "runescapeExp* SERVER_EXPERIENCE"
public int recoilDamage;
public int recoilPercent;
public boolean ssemallikybedamsawsiht = true;[/code]

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("help") && help) { teleportToX = 2525; teleportToY = 4773; } else { sendMessage("You cannot do this, the help session is over."); }

item.title: Using commands at a certain time?
item.dc:creator: @Adelmas Adelmas
item.description:
@Adelmas wrote:

Here is what I have now, errors still come up though.

[code]if(command.startsWith(“helpsession”)) {// && playerRights > 1) {
sendMessage(“Prepare to be drowned with noob questions.”);
teleportToX = 2966;
teleportToY = 3381;
yell (“Help session in Falador, type ::help”);
help = true;
}

	boolean help = false;

	if(command.startsWith("disablesession")) {// && playerRights > 1) {
		sendMessage("You no longer have to listen to noob quesitons.");
		teleportToX = 2525;
		teleportToY = 4773;
		yell ("The help session is over");	
		help = false;
	}

	if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("help")) && help) {
	teleportToX = 2525;
	teleportToY = 4773;
	else;
	sendMessage("You cannot do this, the help session is over.");
	}[/code]

Did I put the boolean in the right spot now?

Is that right?

Read full topic

item.title: Using commands at a certain time?
item.dc:creator: @Adelmas Adelmas
item.description:
@Adelmas wrote:

Here’s what I have, but it gives me an error on compiling.

[code]
if(command.startsWith(“helpsession”)) {// && playerRights > 1) {
sendMessage(“Prepare to be drowned with noob questions.”);
teleportToX = 2966;
teleportToY = 3381;
yell (“Help session in Falador, type ::help”);
help = true;
}

	if(command.startsWith("disablesession")) {// && playerRights > 1) {
		sendMessage("You no longer have to listen to noob quesitons.");
		boolean help = false;
		teleportToX = 2525;
		teleportToY = 4773;
		yell ("The help session is over");	
		help = false;
	}

	if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("help") && help) {
	teleportToX = 2525;
	teleportToY = 4773;
	else
	sendMessage("You cannot do this, the help session is over.");
	}[/code]

Ther error:

client.java:5539: 'else' without 'if' else ^

Read full topic
item.source: Using commands at a certain time?

item.title: Using commands at a certain time?
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“Adelmas, post:6, topic:283904”]Where do I declare the boolean?

here is what I have:

[code]
if(command.startsWith(“helpsession”)) {// && playerRights > 1) {
sendMessage(“Prepare to be drowned with noob questions.”);
teleportToX = 2966;
teleportToY = 3381;
yell (“Help session in Falador, type ::help”);
help = true;
}

	if(command.startsWith("disablesession")) {// && playerRights > 1) {
		sendMessage("You no longer have to listen to noob quesitons.");
		teleportToX = 2525;
		teleportToY = 4773;
		yell ("The help session is over");	
		help = false;
	}

	if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("help") && help) {
	teleportToX = 2525;
	teleportToY = 4773;
	else
	sendMessage("You cannot do this, the help session is over.");
	}[/code][/quote]

Booleans can be declared anywhere in the class as they’re fields; just make sure they aren’t in another method.

Read full topic
item.source: Using commands at a certain time?

item.title: Using commands at a certain time?
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

Declare a boolean:

boolean help = false;

Create the ‘helpsession’ command:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("helpsession")) { help = true; }

Create the ‘help’ command:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("help") && help) { // command's action else sendMessage("You cannot do this, the help session is over."); }

Create the ‘sessionover’ command:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("sessionover")) { help = false; }

Read full topic
